&bibliography; blocks Block Models: Positional and Role Analysis
Origin: [Lorraine and White 1971] F. Lorraine, H.C. White: "Structural equivalence of individuals in social networks". Journal of Mathematical Sociology, 1:49-80, 1971
Group nodes into blocks according to how similar they are in their connections to others...
e.g. multirelational networks
Steps Prell 2012: 1. Define equivalence, e.g. structural or regular 2. Choose a similarity measure for equivalence, e.g. correlation coefficient or Euclidean distance 3. Assign nodes to positions (blocks) 4. Analyze relations to positions and interpret result
equivalence-structural Structural equivalence
"Same ties to the same nodes"
[Lorraine and White 1971] F. Lorraine, H.C. White: "Structural equivalence of individuals in social networks". Journal of Mathematical Sociology, 1:49-80, 1971
Approximate structural equivalence: distance and correlation... [Burt 1976] R.S. Burt: "Positions in networks", Social Forces 55:93-122 [Faust and Romney 1985] K. Faust, A.K. Romney: "Does STRUCTURE find structure? A critique of Burt's use of distance as a measure of structural equivalence", Social Networks 7:77-103, 1985 [Burt 1986] R.S. - Correlation matrix - Iteration - Density matrix (density within each block) - Image matrix (binarized version of the density matrix, e.g. density criterion rule [Arabie et al. 1978]) - Reduced network (analysis of results)

blocks-stochastic-irm IRM: Infinite relational model
- Infinite: number of clusters increases as we observe more data - Relational: it applies to relational data
[Kemp, C., Tenenbaum, J. B., Griffiths, T. L., Yamada, T. & Ueda, N. (2006): Learning systems of concepts with an infinite relational model. Proceedings of the 21st AAAI.]
[Kemp, C., Griffiths, T. L. & Tenenbaum, J. B. (2004). Discovering latent classes in relational data. MIT TR.]
Related:
[Zhao Xu, Volker Tresp, Kai Yu, and Hans-Peter Kriegel (2006): Infinite Hidden Relational Models. 22nd Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence (UAI)] + Uses Dirichlet distribution.
blocks-stochastic-immm IMMM: Infinite mixed-membership model
..Extension of IRM, handles multiple memberships .. Each cluster is an identity .. A node can have more than one identity .. Each link represents two particular identities of the nodes it connects ..Adopts a hierarchical prior - Chinese Restaurant Franchise
[Airoldi, E.M., Blei, D.M., Fienberg, S.E., & Xing, E.P.: Mixed-membership stochastic blockmodels. Journal of Machine Learning Research, 2008. http://jmlr.csail.mit.edu/papers/volume9/airoldi08a/airoldi08a.pdf]
